result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:04 AM - Case not called on the Record
Attorney Kristi Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Robert Gerald Lebell appeared by video for Jesus A Garcia. 
Defendant Jesus A Garcia in court. 
Court sets Motion to Suppress.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence and Statements;  filed by Atty. Robert Lebell;  
**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 09-15-2022:  scheduling to be addressed at hearing on 09-16-2022.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:57 AM Defendant Jesus A Garcia in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel advised he intends to file motions.  Court will reset matters for status in about 60 days and advised Defense counsel if motions are filed, the Clerk's office will reach out for scheduling.  Hearing scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:30 AM   File not called on the record.
Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Jesus A Garcia in court by zoom with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Lebell requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:36 AM Defendant Jesus A Garcia in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Lesli S Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Jesus A Garcia in court with attorney Robert Gerald Lebell.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Attorney Robert LeBell

Hearing on March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

03:27 PM Defendant Jesus A Garcia in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tapia appears as friend of the court as the defendant indicates he intends on retaining Attorney Robert Lebell as counsel.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
